intro: Pedicularis canadensis f. typica, commonly known as the Canadian lousewort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, typically pink or purple, which are adapted for pollination by bees and other insects. It grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are often alternate and can be lance-shaped or ovate, with a hairy texture.
